description: From Middle English remisse, remysse, from Latin remissus (“languid, negligent”), perfect passive participle of remittere (“remit”).

entries.meaning: At fault; failing to fulfill responsibility, duty, or obligations.
examples: I would certainly be remiss if I did not give credit where credit was due.

entries.meaning: Not energetic or exact in duty or business; careless; tardy; slack; hence, lacking earnestness or activity; languid; slow.
